Package controllers

Class ModifyPartController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.ModifyPartController
  • public class ModifyPartController
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles interactions with the part form.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Part currentPart
      The current part associated with a modify action.
      private javafx.scene.control.RadioButton inHouseRadioButton
      The radio button indicating the part is made in-house.
      private javafx.scene.Scene mainScene
      A reference to the application's main scene.
      private MainWindowController mainWindowController
      A reference to the main scene's controller for communication purposes.
      private javafx.scene.control.RadioButton outsourcedRadioButton
      The radio button indicating the part is outsourced.
      private javafx.scene.control.Label partFormErrorTextField
      The label used to display the errors found when adding or modifying a part.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField partFormIDTextField
      The text field used to display the part's ID.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField partFormInvTextField
      The text field used to enter or display a part's inventory level.
      private javafx.scene.control.Label partFormLabel
      The top text in the part form indicating whether the current use of the form is in modify or add mode.
      private javafx.scene.control.Label partFormMachineIDLabel
      The label that switched between "Machine ID" and "Company Name," depending on the state of the inHouseRadioButton and outsourcedRadioButton.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField partFormMachineIDTextField
      The text field used to enter or display a part's Machine ID or Company Name.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField partFormMaxTextField
      The text field used to enter or display a part's maximum allowable inventory quantity.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField partFormMinTextField
      The text field used to enter or display a part's minimum allowable inventory quantity.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField partFormNameTextField
      The text field used to enter or display a part's name.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField partFormPriceTextField
      The text field used to enter or display a part's price.
      private javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage
      A reference to the application's primary stage.

      • ModifyPartController

        public ModifyPartController()

    • Method Detail

      • setMainWindowController

        public void setMainWindowController​(MainWindowController controller)
        Sets this class's reference to the mainWindowController. Used to refresh the main window's part and product TableViews.
        Parameters:
        controller - The application's main scene/window

      • setMainScene

        public void setMainScene​(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
        Sets this class's reference to the main scene.
        Parameters:
        scene - The application's main scene.

      • setPrimaryStage

        public void setPrimaryStage​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Sets this class's reference to the primary stage.
        Parameters:
        stage - The application's primary stage.

      • initializeNewPartForm

        public void initializeNewPartForm()
        Called from the mainWindowController when the add part button is pressed. Sets all the input text fields to empty and gives the new part a unique id.

      • initializeModifyPartForm

        public void initializeModifyPartForm​(Part part)
        Called from the mainWindowController when the modify part button is pressed. Sets all the input text fields to be populated by the selected part's values.
        Parameters:
        part - The part to modify.

      • partFormSaveButtonListener

        public void partFormSaveButtonListener()
        Called when the save button is pressed. Will save the modified part or add a new part, as long as no input has invalid values and return to the main scene. If there are invalid values, the partFormErrorTextField will be set to display the errors and the application stays on the part form.

      • partFormCancelButtonListener

        public void partFormCancelButtonListener()
        Called when the cancel button is pressed. Returns the application to the main scene, discarding any changes to a part.

      • inHouseRadioButtonListener

        public void inHouseRadioButtonListener()
        Called when the inHouseRadioButton is selected. Sets the partFormMachineIDLabel to "Machine ID"

      • outsourcedRadioButtonListener

        public void outsourcedRadioButtonListener()
        Called when the outsourcedRadioButton is selected. Sets the partFormMachineIDLabel to "Company Name"
